title: ‘Maye Way, baby’: Drake Maye’s older brothers give him inspiring messages ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye's brothers sent him inspiring messages before Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks.
Maye's brothers, Luke, Cole, and Beau, emphasized his hard work and the 'Maye Way' family mantra.
Drake Maye is the youngest in a family with significant athletic success, including his father and brothers.

title: Norwell needlepoint shop gets boost from Ann Michael Maye’s post
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Ann Michael Maye's social media post boosts business for Greenhouse Needlepoint in Norwell.
Shop's Instagram following grew 18% in a week after Maye's post showcasing a 'I Love Drake Maye' canvas.
Greenhouse Needlepoint launched in January 2025, offering hand-painted canvases and building a creative community.

title: The most unforgettable Patriots Super Bowl moments fans still talk about
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Readers recall Super Bowl XLIX, where Malcolm Butler's interception secured a win against the Seattle Seahawks.
Super Bowl LI stands out for the Patriots' comeback from a 28-3 deficit against the Atlanta Falcons in 2017.
The Patriots' first title in Super Bowl XXXVI in 2002 marked a pivotal moment with Adam Vinatieri's game-winning kick.

title: Former Mass General employee’s anti-ICE video prompts response from hospital
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts General Hospital distanced itself from a video by former employee Christina criticizing ICE.
Christina, identified by an MGH badge, posted a video mouthing song lyrics and condemning ICE.
Mass General confirmed Christina was a former temporary employee, stating she hadn't worked there for some time.

title: The unwritten rules of skiing and riding on a mountain, according to readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Readers emphasize avoiding loud music on chairlifts and gondolas, urging polite behavior and clear communication.
Common advice for skiers includes not stopping in the middle of slopes and maintaining safe distances.
Inside ski lodges, users recommend properly using ski racks and not monopolizing tables with personal items.

title: Jayson Tatum still has ‘a ways to go’ to return as Brad Stevens says Celtics’ star didn’t have impact on deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum is still recovering from an Achilles tear and is not expected to return imminently.
The Celtics traded Anfernee Simons for Nikola Vucevic, unaffected by Tatum's current recovery status.
Brad Stevens emphasized Tatum won't return until he's fully healthy and mentally ready to play again.

title: Back in California, Patriots safety duo’s journey to Super Bowl LX has come full circle
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Craig Woodson and Jaylinn Hawkins, former Cal teammates, are key to the Patriots' defense in Super Bowl LX.
Woodson and Hawkins became starters after New England released Jabrill Peppers and traded Kyle Dugger in 2025.
In the 2025 season, Hawkins recorded 71 tackles and 4 interceptions, while Woodson excelled in postseason play.

title: A Mass. man was found dead in a trash can in S.C. Here’s what we know.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: David Hutchinson from Oakham, Massachusetts, was found dead in a trash can in Marion, South Carolina.
Jaida Braddy was charged as an accessory after admitting to helping dispose of Hutchinson's body.
Hutchinson's death is under investigation as a homicide by Marion police, who are seeking more suspects.

title: Puppy Bowl XXII: Meet Team Ruff’s and Team Fluff’s representatives from New England rescues
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Thirteen local dogs from Massachusetts, Maine, and Connecticut will participate in Puppy Bowl XXII.
Lobster Roll, a bulldog-border collie mix from Maine, plays for Team Ruff in Puppy Bowl XXII.
All participating dogs have been adopted, but their rescues continue to have other animals available.

title: Look inside this newly renovated Lake Winnipesaukee resort
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mill Falls Resort in Meredith, N.H., completed a renovation of its four buildings, including Chase House and Palmer Inn.
The resort features six restaurants, pools, spa, and activity center with seasonal activities such as kayaking and snowshoeing.
Room updates at Chase House and Palmer Inn include 'coastal modern style,' with fireplaces and balconies with water views.
